publicationStmt.ps: Published by Leonard and Virginia Woolf

text.p:
Good-evening,
Mrs. Misses McNab, she would say. She had a pleasant way with her. The girls all liked her. But dear, many things had changed since then (she shut the drawer); many families had lost their dearest. So she was dead; and
Mr. Mister
Andrew killed; and
Dr. Doctor
Prue dead too, they said, with her first baby; but everyone had lost some one these years. Prices had gone up shamefully, and didn't come down again neither. She could well remember her in her grey cloak.
